DOC.brief_summary: This study seek enroll neonate require Nasal Continuous Airway Pressure ( NCPAP ) respiratory support randomize either oscillatory ( Osc-NCPAP , study group ) non-oscillatory ( NCPAP , control group ) mode . The goal research determine Osc-NCPAP provide improved ventilation support compare routine NCPAP , i.e . NCPAP without oscillation . This measure need change ventilator support , improvement pCO2 value , reduction respiratory rate frequency apnea period NCPAP treatment . Other respiratory outcome also compare , include time NCPAP , time High-Flow Nasal Cannula support follow NCPAP , time-averaged PiO2 start study end respiratory treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Oscillatory Versus Non-Oscillatory Nasal Continuous Airway Pressure Neonatal Respiratory Support
DOC.criteria: Newborn ( 028 day age ) admit Neonatal Intensive Care Unit ( NICU ) Ordered respiratory treatment NCPAP Major congenital defect Known suspect chromosomal disorder
